result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 10/27/22.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights.
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
-Court set restitution at zero.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Vargas appeared by video.  Attorney Taylor Haefele for Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Antonio Vargas.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days served. Huber privileges for work. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/27/22.

Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for Final pre-Trial. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 08/08/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Vargas in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LE.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Antonio Vargas in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
